item.title: ‘Bow to the Emperor’: We Asked 50 Legal Experts About the Trump Presidency
item.description: Before the election, we surveyed the legal establishment about what a second Trump term could mean for the rule of law. A year later, they’re very, very worried.

item.title: They Got to Live a Life of Luxury. Then Came the Fine Print.
item.description: ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ has built a delirious new culture of consumption — and trapped users in a vortex of debt.

item.title: Lie About Your Age. It’s Fun!
item.description: Free, easy and old-fashioned, lying is an anti-aging supplement for the masses.

item.title: Embrace the Potato Dinner
item.description: A former restaurant critic, now on a health journey, finds steady comfort in these spiced stovetop spuds.

item.title: Life Got Hard. The Sims Got Easy.
item.description: As the daily grind becomes “gamified,” players are nostalgic for older, more chaotic versions of the life simulation game

item.title: Should I Keep Donating to an Animal Shelter That Treats Employees Badly?
item.description: If I stop donating, the animals lose; if I continue, am I enabling questionable practices?

item.title: Thomas Pynchon Saw Where America Was Headed. What Does He See Now?
item.description: The novelist anticipated our bizarre present. How does his latest book hold up in an age of eroding reality?

item.title: If an Energy Drink Drank an Energy Drink, You’d Get a Celsius
item.description: How a turbocharged upstart brand came to threaten Red Bull and Monster’s dominance.

item.title: Do Spouses Have Mustache Veto Power?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over the limits of facial-hair autonomy.

item.title: How Getting Stoned With My Dad Helped Us Heal
item.description: It was the therapy we needed, and the fun we deserved, after decades of estrangement.

item.title: What’s Better Than Carrot Cake? This Sweet Potato Version.
item.description: Here, this riff on the classic is more than just a clever trick: It’s a testament to the past.

item.title: I Cut Off a Friend Who Was Abusing Her Daughter. What Can I Do for the Child?
Taylor Swift Is Our Biggest Cinematic Universe. But the Magic Is Fading.
item.description: Pop culture is saturated with franchises, and Swift is the master of creating them. But her marketing is beginning to overtake the music.

item.title: The Ultimate Pilgrimage for the Middle-Aged Skateboarder
item.description: One of America’s most iconic ’90s skate spots has now been rebuilt in — of all places — Malmo, Sweden.
